website_summaries.verdict: With plenty of professional-grade features, this mid-priced camera is more suitable for pros than novices.
cons: A complex camera with a steep learning curve for beginners
Some report lens flare issues but free corrective maintenance available

website_summaries.verdict: It's not the cheapest camera in its class, but the Nikon D750 delivers an excellent combination of quality, performance and features for its price.
pros: The Nikon D750 delivers the best photo quality and continuous-shooting performance in its price class, along with a nicely well-rounded feature set
cons: Nikon's Wi-Fi implementation is weak and some of the other features could be executed a little better
Plus Live View performance is sad

website_summaries.verdict: The Nikon D750 delivers pro-level performance at a reasonable asking price, making it our Editor's Choice for full-frame DSLRs under $2,500.
cons: GPS module is a pricey add-on

customer_reviews.title: Used Grey Market
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this camera in 2017, camera worked great. Had a mechanical issue that needed repair. I sent this into Nikon and they would not perform any service on it. They said it was grey market meaning that it was originally purchased outside the USA. I bought this off Amazon, not knowing that it was a grey market item or knowing the products origin. This ended up being a total waste of money. Save your money, buy from Nikon direct. There is no way to determine if a camera originates in the US or not. There doesn't seem to be any way to reconcile with the vendor or Amazon either..
customer_reviews.author: sam pep

customer_reviews.title: I highly recommend this camera
customer_reviews.text: Arrived brand new and in pristine condition. There wasn't even a scratch on the box. The D750 functions flawlessly. Excellent low light performance, focusing on subjects in the extremely dark conditions. Paired it with the new Tamron 70-200mm SP G2, with which it works brilliantly. The ease of function is pro grade but not complicated. You can tell Nikon put a lot of thought into the menu and controls. This is an excellent camera and Adorama delivers it to you in pristine condition. I highly recommend this camera
customer_reviews.author: TheOwl360Top Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy from Kent house-jp!!! They are Japan models they are selling!
customer_reviews.text: Sells Japanese cameras and lens that Nikon will REFUSE to repair IF you ever need any form of repair. Warning to all! If you break a lens, need your camera re-calibrated which I did from the second it arrived to my house Nikon will not do it. Also the camera they sent me is all messed up.... from the first photo taken they are blurry. I am furious.
customer_reviews.author: Shopping Mom of 4

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding body
customer_reviews.text: I switched to Nikon from Canon in 1998 and have never looked back. Six bodies and a dozen Nikkor lenses later I still love Nikon. I moved up from a D610 this time, which is really good, but the low light focusing became a problem for my new passion of wildlife photography. Fits my hand like a glove, lighter, better sensor and processor. Nothing but primes for this body. Have a Z6 too, but at this point the D750 is a better working body.
customer_reviews.author: S. W.

customer_reviews.title: Best Compromise of Quality and Price With Current Pricing
customer_reviews.text: When I purchased mine recently, the price was reduced by 25%. How can anyone go wrong for that investment? Certainly produces quality images. I also shoot with a D810, and find that I rarely need files that large. The 24 MP files of this camera are a great compromise of size and file storage requirements, both in camera and afterward. If Nikon runs that sale again, grab one. The higher priced Nikons aren't worth the huge cost for most pros, let alone for those who just want a great camera. Anyone with good skills will take wonderful images with this camera!
customer_reviews.author: Johnny Photo

customer_reviews.title: Gray Market camera
customer_reviews.text: Three years later I find out that he sold me a gray market (non-USA) camera. Be sure to ask before you buy
customer_reviews.author: K. Palmer

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous
customer_reviews.text: I moved up from a D90, which is a great camera. I've had the D750 for around 6 months and love it. The image quality in low light is fabulous. The overall image quality is a huge improvement over the D90. Auto focus is fast and accurate. It too works well in low light. The build is very solid and fits well in my hand. I've used it mostly for stills so I can't really comment on the video functions. I'm an amateur photographer so this was an extravagance for me but has made my hobby a great deal more enjoyable. I feel like I'll be able to keep this camera for years and be happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Jtyrie

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: So, my d500 suddenly had issues after 2months wouldn't stop back focussing, meaning focus was off no matter lens or fine tuning. Had bought it used, not from Amazon, with a 90 day warranty, never got back to me and Amazon still gave me a return.... I was dumbfounded. I was able to get this one thanks to that and it's not bad. US warranty so I know I'm protected at least and I could afford it. pics were with good and great glass Doves Tamron 150-600 usd and Robin & Hummingbird Nikon 70-200 f2.8. So far so good looking forward to getting out in the field to give it a real test.
customer_reviews.author: David Johnson

customer_reviews.title: A versatile full frame Camera designed for the Enthusiast
customer_reviews.text: I was a Nikon D3200 shooter when i decided to take my Photography interest to the next level and acquire a Nikon FX Camera. The price point on Amazon for the Nikon D750 was right for me and so I went for it. After studying the manual and investing in a good handbook, I started shooting Landscapes and Portraits on the Nikon D750. Let me say I have been much impressed with the results . The Camera sensor has great dynamic range, low noise at high ISOs and the ability to shoot in 14 bit RAW format. Besides this it has excellent video capabilities with a Tilt LCD screen. A few pictures have been posted here.
customer_reviews.author: George Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Defective from the start
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this camera when it first came out in September 2014. It has not worked properly from day one. The camera had problems with underexposed pictures and the computer system in the camera malfunctions. It will stop taking pictures and then will not turn off. I have to remove the battery just to power it off. There has been 2 service advisories (or recalls) on this camera. I have sent in for repair 3 times to nikon, and still having the same issues. Buyer Beware!!!!
customer_reviews.author: marian fordham

customer_reviews.title: Even as long as the D750 has been out it still s great camera.
customer_reviews.text: Really satisfied with the d750! I’ve been amateur photographer for 50 years starting with a Minolta SRT 101 with a single 35mm 1.4 lens adding additional inexpensive lenses over the years, taking pictures for my own enjoyment. Then film disappeared and I’ve owned a few digital cameras. A few years ago I bought the D5500 kit with two lenses and really enjoyed it and recently saw a very nice price for a new D750. The D750 has more bells and whistles on it than I’ll probably ever use. It looks, feels and operates like a great camera. I have a couple good lenses and look forward to learning to use this camera.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love the camera. Happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.text: Great camera ... stepped up from a Nikon 5500. Noticed better quality shooting with the full frame right away. It's a bit heavier than the 5500, but not a big deal. Definitely would recommend the camera.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: an amazing full frame camera...
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded to the D750 after starting out with an entry level Nikon crop sensor (APS-C) camera. Wow what a difference! The D750 has tons of great features and capabilities and I am very pleased with the purchase so far. The camera has been around for several years now so there are lots of great tutorials on-line about the most efficient camera settings based on your preferences. I took the D750 on a recent trip and was very happy with the performance. I've got a bit more work to do learning about all of the great features but I am very happy with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: JM

customer_reviews.title: Wow! Simply, wow!
customer_reviews.text: Wow! Everything I expected and then some! Better then the 810 in that it does everything very very well if not perfectly. D4s is lightning with a great processor. D750 is pretty darn fast with that same processor, stupendous ISO, compact too. I usually prefer 'bigger' but this thing is just the right size in every way. D810 has the megapixels, but that's about all it's got over the 750. I did a lot of research on this thing there's really no reason to go with anything else if you're going full frame/pro. I'd get the D7200 if I was staying in crop but I decided to move it on up and I'm glad I did.
customer_reviews.author: Madjpey

customer_reviews.title: FX rules
customer_reviews.text: i've been shooting with nikon cameras for almost 20 years now. this is my first fx camera, albeit the entry-level model. i believe the biggest two gains are being able to use the wide end of my lens, e.g., my 16mm shoots like a 16 mm, not a 24 mm. the range on my 24-85 is 24-85, not 36-127.5. the second gain is the much improved iso sensitivity range, 100-12800 versus 100-6400. had no problems with this shipper either, receiving my camera promptly ;-)
customer_reviews.author: S. Ortisi

customer_reviews.title: Shutter issue
customer_reviews.text: Mine was not affected by the flare but with the shutter issue. Not long after I purchased it, I started seeing the error message and shutter lag at high speeds at start up. I sent in for repair under warranty. (That was before the Service Advisory came out). According to the paper that came back with the "repaired" camera, they recalibrated the shutter. Well, that did not help me because the problem came back. Now with the service advisory, I could send back yet again but I do not have much faith.
customer_reviews.author: Soyolbold Sergelen

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera That Won’t Burst Your Wallet
customer_reviews.text: Great camera! Purchased this one as my second body to go with my 80-200mm lens. Got another one for my 16-36mm both are the perfect combination to cover events. The full frame very crispy 23 MP sensor maximizes the use of all my Nikon lenses, even my 30 years old 55mm Micro works perfectly with it. With the Wi-Fi mode I can right away, share some shots with my clients so they can make press releases or start impacting social webs.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Really loving this camera. I spent a lot of ...
customer_reviews.text: Really loving this camera. I spent a lot of time reading the reviews. I especially appreciated the detailed ones from what appeared to be experienced photographers. I haven't found anything I didn't like--well, there is one thing that I wish were different. The view finder doesn't show the full size so framing through the viewfinder doesn't give you exactly what you saw, but that's something to adapt to and is not a flaw in the camera.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Xavier

customer_reviews.title: D600 --> D750
customer_reviews.text: Coming from the D600 and having researched this purchase for probably 2 years.. I am so literally blown away by the upgrade that I can't believe I waited this long. The colors are far more accurate, there are no oil issues from the sensor and the biggest win by far for me is the ISO Performance of this Nikon Body. Even at 12,800 I'm able to get perfectly usable images where the D600 at 2000 ISO was debatable. All bets are off, Nikon has done an insane job creating an amazing camera body!
customer_reviews.author: Todd Bailey

customer_reviews.title: Best camera!
customer_reviews.text: This camera is amazing. I have 2 and use them for weddings and portrait sessions. I have never had a problem with it! Really user friends and much more affordable than some of the other brands. This is a top of the line camera and I love it! The color tones when you shoot in camera are just amazing!!
customer_reviews.author: Jerry Smith

customer_reviews.title: Love this camera!
customer_reviews.text: I have had this camera since it first came out and I just purchased it again so I have a backup! I have had zero problems with it and it has been great in all lighting situations! I've shot weddings and a LOT of portraits! The noise at high ISO is fantastic as well!
customer_reviews.author: AClarkPhoto

customer_reviews.title: Major upgrade
customer_reviews.text: I'm learning how to use this camera even though I've had it awhile. Compared to the D5100 this is a major upgrade for me. I've looked at videos, friends with D series camera have given me pointers, read books and online camera tips. I should have given it 5 stars but I want to reserve the fifth star for future review. I'm not the one to answer questions about this camera because I'm still learning a newbie.
customer_reviews.author: Gerry Clemmer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to learn and use.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great camera. It does it all. I love sunsets, city, stars/Milky Way people and pets and the D750 can handle it will with easy. I hardly ever shot video so I didn’t see the need to spend more money on the D780. The built in effects give you more ways to be creative and have some fun. If most of what you shot is stills this is the camera for you.
customer_reviews.author: Newmansdad

customer_reviews.title: Great camera for the money
customer_reviews.text: Bought it used on Amazon. Have loved it. My first Nikon DSLR. I had a Pentax K20D (APS-C) for about 10 years and felt it was time to try full-frame, and wanted better AF capability than that offered in any full-frame Pentax system. This is a great camera that will give you many pro features without breaking the bank. Easy to use and I love the dynamic range I get, which is improved further by easy-to-use bracketing.
customer_reviews.author: ZZiglar

customer_reviews.title: Love this camera
customer_reviews.text: I am obsessed with this camera! I purchased this as an upgrade for my D5200 and I'm so glad I did. The controls are definitely different which takes some getting used to, but the range and quality of this camera is much better than my previous one. The photos are less noisy, sharper, and the full frame is a wonderful upgrade. I also have control of the color temperature with this camera which the D5200 didn't have. This camera works with the DX lenses that I had previously purchased, but it does crop them unless that setting is changed.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea

customer_reviews.title: Yep, it's that good.
customer_reviews.text: It's pretty much ridiculous. Unreal sensitivity, better than film dynamic range and tonal range of the colors. Great shooting modes. Makes most of the right decisions, and if not, it's easy to nudge in the right direction. Tons of detail to extract from images, great-looking JPEGs. I use it as a studio camera to photo document artists' work on canvas, where resolution and color fidelity and range are critical. Never taken better photos in 20 years. As a walk-around camera it's pretty beefy, but not absurdly so. It handles great, and allows me to get shots that I would have previously struggled for. A joy.
customer_reviews.author: S. Sneddon

customer_reviews.title: Great camera
customer_reviews.text: The d750 is a huge step up from my D90 that I was so used to. It shoots a little cooler then I am used to on the Kelvin setting which is the only learning curve that I am dealing with. I get sharp as a tack images and it is great for chasing Toddlers and low-lighting.
customer_reviews.author: Sandi

customer_reviews.title: If you are going to buy a new camera, I highly recommend this one.
customer_reviews.text: This is the best camera I have ever owned. My previous camera was a Nikon D5200, DX format, and this camera blows it away. I have small hand, and it fits perfectly. It's light, has the ability to use almost every lens Nikkor/Nikon has ever made, and the built in options seem limitless. It is intuitive to use, in many respects, but the manual is very comprehensive, and there are now many books to supplement the manual. If you are going to buy a new camera, I highly recommend this one.
customer_reviews.author: edabq

customer_reviews.title: Metallic "ping" sound when shutter is released
customer_reviews.text: The camera is great, ok. But I received not ONE but TWO defective cameras. The first one I exchanged because of the "ping (metal on metal) sound when I pressed the shutter. I have 2 other camera bodies, so I know there is a difference in sound. Long story the second D750 I received developed the same defect overtime. Amazon has just issued me a REFUND, so that's cool. But I still need to buy another D750 :(
customer_reviews.author: nicosemo

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic combination of light weight and professional features.
customer_reviews.text: Big photo shoot all week long with 8000 images taken. Camera performed flawlessly and gets great image count per battery charge. The built in pop up flash is very useful for fill flash if you don’t want to get out a bigger flash to put in the hot you. The light weight of this camera with full feature package is a great combination. Nikon finally lowered the price so I can afford it.
customer_reviews.author: Evelyn Stewart

customer_reviews.title: 6400 iso with little to no grain is amazing in comparison to my old body
customer_reviews.text: After using a D90 for the last four or five years, the low light capabilities in this camera absolutely blow me away. 6400 iso with little to no grain is amazing in comparison to my old body. This camera shoots very warm in color, though, which is unexpected, and I've had to fiddle with many of the settings to get it just right, but I wouldn't trade this for any other camera out there right now.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Hanna

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the price!
customer_reviews.text: 1st full frame camera! I love that it's a little more rugged than the other Nikon's I have purchased, I lug it around everywhere with me! Slightly used is what I purchased and it came in the original box with all accessories and had a 0 on the frame counter! I seriously love this camera!
customer_reviews.author: Chip

customer_reviews.title: The perfect camera
customer_reviews.text: Love my Nikon D750! I upgraded from a D7000. I was happy to see there isn’t much of a learning curve at all since all of my favorite features from the D7000 are there with the D750. Overall great camera!
customer_reviews.author: VeeRich

customer_reviews.title: Just got this camera and have only tried it for ...
customer_reviews.text: Just got this camera and have only tried it for 2 days. So far, I’m loving the quality. I paired it with the sigma art 135mm f1.8 lens. The two together take ama I gotta pictures. Down size.....this is the 2nd Nikon product I have purchased through amazon. Both times there was an issue with it arriving as stated. I’m not sure if it’s an amazon issue or a Nikon issue. It wasn’t enough of a problem for me to give less than a 5 star review
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great upgrade from my D7000
customer_reviews.text: Upgraded from a D7000. Has a lot better low light quality! I shoot portraits, sports and my family stuff and this works great! Buttons are almost identical to my D7000 so it was an easy transition. So happy with my purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Mama L

customer_reviews.title: MY FAVORITE DSLR
customer_reviews.text: THEE BEST CAMERA IVE OWNED!! I started with nikon d3100, 3200, 7000, and 7100. This one is by far thee best! It is full frame, so an FX lens would be ideal. Other than having to spend a little more for FX lenses, its worth it. The quality outweighs the costs. DX lenses stilll work but there is a crop factor
customer_reviews.author: ReVamp Mommy

customer_reviews.title: Great camera & Honest Seller
customer_reviews.text: So far this camera is better than what I expected. It arrived on time, in great shape. I own several Nikon cameras so I know what to check and how to put it through test. The shutter count was very low considering it was a used camera. The body was in great shape and there were no defects as far as I can see. I have shot a volleyball game and a graduation with no problems. The camera is awesome and the seller did not overstate the camera, actually the camera is better condition than what I expected.
customer_reviews.author: T. Austin

customer_reviews.title: In LOVE with this camera!!
customer_reviews.text: I want to be serious with my photography business so I got this and it does not disappoint! I had my first photo session last weekend and the pictures are amazing ❤️ i just need to learn how to use it more since it is slightly different from my d5000. Cant wait to explore it more!
customer_reviews.author: C Hdz

customer_reviews.title: ... loves this camera and we got some really really great pictures for our Paris and Italy trips
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves this camera and we got some really really great pictures for our Paris and Italy trips. The only bummer is Nikon started dropping the price of this camera so quickly after it came out. Some attributed this to the banding issue that the camera had, but honestly looking at all the pictures we took during our two European vacations, we didn't have a single occasion where that became an issue. What was apparent about this camera was that the sensor itself was great and fast, also, my husband paired this with his Nikon "Trinity" 2.8 lenses and we were great some really great pictures.
customer_reviews.author: Lijing Du

customer_reviews.title: Excellent low-light focusing!
customer_reviews.text: I got this camera as an upgrade from the D610, after experiencing some low light focusing issues with that model. I can definitely say that it was received just in time. A recent outdoor wedding was pushed back until after sundown and the lighting under the pergola was inoperable. The D750 focused well in the low light and I was able to get some nice images.
customer_reviews.author: Marcellas M. Prather

customer_reviews.title: My fifth Nikon.  D750 is great
customer_reviews.text: I am a longtime photographer and run a small side business from home. This camera is my fifth Nikon (I have owned D50, D70, D5000, D700 and now D750) Functions well and takes great pictures. The lenses, of course, are where you get your real stunning pictures. So don't skimp on great glass, buy the best you can afford. VR (vibration reduction) if you can.
customer_reviews.author: Theresa

customer_reviews.title: Best in Price
customer_reviews.text: The Nikon D750 is a full-frame DSLR for the kind of photographer who wants a camera one step down from the pro models. You get the low-light flexibility that comes with a full-frame sensor, and some features generally left out of the top models – all without some of the extra cost of other big names.
customer_reviews.author: Jess

customer_reviews.title: Love it!!
customer_reviews.text: Love this camera! Been pretty amazed with the detail when I enlarge the image on the LCD screen. I do that often to check for blinking eyes and other odd stuff. This is by far the best Nikon camera I have ever owned. Love the video mode. I can change the aperture, shutter speed and ISO all while recording. Has a very deep grip that makes it feel very good in hand. I have been very impressed with the images I have gotten with it so far.
customer_reviews.author: Stewie510

customer_reviews.title: Worth your money !
customer_reviews.text: It takes a while to learn all the functions but well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Second Time Around
customer_reviews.text: This is the second D750 camera that I have bought through Amazon. This is not a third party item, and overall, I am very pleased with this work horse. Note: Make sure to register it as soon as it arrives, as the one year warranty expires 10 days after purchase. I's suggest purchasing an extended warranty through the manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: Mary F.C.

customer_reviews.title: I absolutely love this camera
customer_reviews.text: Great all around camera. The dynamic range of this camera is amazing. The video that comes out of the d750 is amazing quality as well. Great low light capabilities and handles high iso very well with very minimal noise when using higher iso.
customer_reviews.author: Jasper

customer_reviews.title: Great camera especially for landscapes
customer_reviews.text: Great camera especially for landscapes, particularly with Nikon 14-24 and Nikon 24-70. Fairly easy to customize, great dynamic range, and relatively lightweight. Haven't used a 70-200 f2.8 on it yet. It may need a battery grip for longer lenses, including Nikon 24-70. Tamron 24-70 balances very nicely w/out the grip on the D750 but was difficult to get focus consistently accurate.
customer_reviews.author: Ellen M.

customer_reviews.title: Love this camera
customer_reviews.text: A year ago, I traded in all my professional Nikon gear and switched to Fuji. I love my Fuji system. I so missed my Nikon d750 that I bought it again. While I still use Fuji for 95% of my work, sometimes I just want my Nikon back. I love this camera.
customer_reviews.author: Ann Miller

customer_reviews.title: Old but gold
customer_reviews.text: My first pro camera. Did lots of research and it came down to this beauty. With manual mode you can take some awesome pictures.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Magana

customer_reviews.title: Great image quality and high speed digital functions..  Turn it on and go.
customer_reviews.text: I decided to get back into photography after years of using small digitals and cell phone cameras. The image quality is superb. The camera shutter is very fast. You don't have to wait for the camera to get ready to shoot. just turn it on and go. It has a lot of features and I have barely scratched the surface of what it can do. But with a new Nikkor lens, it's amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Ramblin Man

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect full frame upgrade from my D7100's. The aesthetic designs of the two are virtually the same, the look and feel of it was already familiar to me. May get another one, for event shooting purposes.
customer_reviews.author: Reginald Graddy

customer_reviews.title: Comaring to D800
customer_reviews.text: I’m comparing it to my D800: Image on D750 is too soft which is a big deal. Additionally, there is sufficiently less details here. This is comparable to sony mirrorless cameras not with pro dslrs. I suggest buying a used D800 or D810 over this.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonCustomer

customer_reviews.title: Still the best Nikon.
customer_reviews.text: A few years old yet still my favorite dslr. The size is perfect. The carbon fiber mixed body makes the weight perfect and doesn’t feel like a brick like the D810 etc. the grip is absolutely the best grip on a dslr. 24mp is plenty, dynamic range is still unbelievable. I hope they don’t screw up the mark I version of this.
customer_reviews.author: Robbie G

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded from a D3300 and I couldn’t be happier!! The item shipped with absolutely no damage. Before I used it I charge the battery completely then popped it in and was ready to go!
customer_reviews.author: Jaclyntara

customer_reviews.title: LOVE
customer_reviews.text: Love this camera - clearer photos than my D3200. Significantly better in lower light situation and faster shutter speed was able to catch pedals in the air!
customer_reviews.author: Fun&Games

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING CAMERA!
customer_reviews.text: The image quality from this camera is incredible. I upgraded from a D3400 and I’m so so happy I did. It’s quick and the auto focus on on point. Best camera I could have purchased for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle K

customer_reviews.title: The cat's meow?
customer_reviews.text: All the settings & abilities of any DSLR in the advanced/expert class you could ask for, especially for the money. It is solid - I'd dare say, a work horse. The control's placement on the camera body is tried and true and allow for rapid setting adjustment on the fly. The CMOS sensor reproduces extremely well. I expect to still be using this 8 years from now which is saying a lot in today's rapidly evolving digital imaging technologies fields.
customer_reviews.author: JdR

customer_reviews.title: AN ABSOLUTELY FANTASTIC FULL-FRAME CAMERA - ONE OF THE VERY BEST EVER
customer_reviews.text: I also own a Nikon D800E. This camera is second only to the D800E only because it has a slightly lower MP count, which really shouldn't matter to most people. 24MP is plenty and there are many features and aspects of it that are better than the D800. The ergonomics are better and it is an easier camera to handle for the most part. It's just a superb camera in every respect. I highly recommend it to anyone in the market for a full-frame Nikon.
customer_reviews.author: Guy Dagar

customer_reviews.title: D750 Trustworthy Buy
customer_reviews.text: No image stabilization in body since it’s a Nikon DSLR so no expectation there. But happy to have this camera with low shutter count and good price used. Seller was awesome and worked through question of Nikon shutter recall which did not apply to this particular body. Shutter and camera controls all work great and camera is in pristine condition. Very happy buyer and looking forward to using for its intended low light and landscape shooting with f2.8 14-24 mm.
customer_reviews.author: A. Cox

customer_reviews.title: Love Nikon and the way they make cameras
customer_reviews.text: Love Nikon and the way they make cameras. I have taken some of my best pictures with this camera. This is a great camera for a wanna be professional photographer. Has all the manual features for creative control and well as good automatic features to just get the shot.
customer_reviews.author: JamesBond

customer_reviews.title: Best camera I've owned in my life.
customer_reviews.text: I'm a commercial photographer, and this is the best camera I've ever owned in my life. Looking at the d850 eventually, but this thing will do the trick for years to come.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Hoffman

customer_reviews.title: Nikon D750 Has made my work flow a lot easier.
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this camera for a few months now and all I can say is wow. Nikon really hit it out the park with this one. I upgraded from a D7000 and it s like a night and day difference. Fast enough for indoor sports with the right lens, great for video also the Tilt screen is a plus.I have been waiting for a camera that can do just about anything and this is it.
customer_reviews.author: Brian H.

customer_reviews.title: Quiet little workhorse camera
customer_reviews.text: This a really amazing camera. I love that ergonomics and weights, to say it's full frame and light weight as it is, is really something. This camera gets focus lock in low light and no light conditions much like it does in the daytime, very quickly. The battery life dwarfs most mirroless camera. The wifi setup takes little bit to get use to, I recommend reading the manual very carefully as before setting the wifi up. On that note being able to wirelessly ship pictures to lightroom or tables gets this camera that fifth star.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Castone

customer_reviews.title: My new best bud
customer_reviews.text: Great camera! I am fairly new to DSLR, started with an entry level camera roughly a year ago and am slowly learning new techniques and expanding my knowledge. I have been getting more serious about photography and decided it was time to take the plunge to full frame. I have only been using the camera for a couple of weeks but I love the features and I am getting super sharp pictures. Great camera!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Okay so far...
customer_reviews.text: This camera body has done me great so far! I’ve had it for a few months now. The only issue is the shutter sticking. I know it’s a common issue with the D750s, but it has happened a decent amount lately. Thankfully I have a backup camera.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Girl

customer_reviews.title: Dependable, superior, improved with wifi
customer_reviews.text: Great improvement over older models with more precise autofocus, metering, and speed of processor without having to go to a professional level camera.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas B.

customer_reviews.title: sp happy with this purchase
customer_reviews.text: This black Friday I decided to upgrade my camera to this one and I couldn't be happier. it was brand new packaged well. great brand.
customer_reviews.author: Giovanni S. Perrone

customer_reviews.title: I'm an amateur photographer and this is perfect for my needs
customer_reviews.text: I'm an amateur photographer and this is perfect for my needs. It gives me enough control over the settings but without a big price tag for features that are beyond my uses. I haven't used the tilt screen yet but I'm excited to when I'm in crowded situations so I can hold my camera above me and see what I'm photographing. I haven't upgraded my equipment in a long time, I had a D90 before this. It is definitely an upgrade!
customer_reviews.author: Erin B Leech

customer_reviews.title: Great camera but still trying to learn some of the ...
customer_reviews.text: Great camera! Still Learning some of the features of this more advance camera. Takes really good pictures. The only thing is it's a little on the heavy side. This is coming from a d5100, of course, I expected this. Love it! Took it out to Marfa, TX and took my very first few shot attempts of the Milky Way with a Nikon 35mm 1.8. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: sensible

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Camera
customer_reviews.text: I have been a Nikon guy since my D100 - this camera is remarkable. There is nothing that I don't love about this camera. It is also the first DSLR that I have that takes video.
customer_reviews.author: Buttershug

customer_reviews.title: The Nikon D750 is the best body I have owned
customer_reviews.text: The Nikon D750 is the best body I have owned. My previous Nikons were the D800, Df, and D300. I have shot almost 7,000 images in the past 7 months. It is rock-solid, has great battery life and takes great pictures. Transferring images to your iPhone is fast and easy with WiFi. I recommend getting the OP/TECH 1501372 Pro Loop Camera Strap from Amazon for extra comfort when carrying your camera.
customer_reviews.author: C. Owenby

customer_reviews.title: Crisp and Clean
customer_reviews.text: I am absolutely in love with my D750! This camera brings me soooo much happiness hehe. I decided to invest in my D750 after months of saving and debating. Now that I bought it, I do not regret it one bit. My images are much more crisp and clean!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect portrait camera
customer_reviews.text: Loving this camera. I upgraded from a D300S, it is a great full frame camera with amazing ISO capabilities. I am a portrait photographer and this has exceeded my expectations.
customer_reviews.author: mandie bunger

customer_reviews.title: I'm Obsessed!!
customer_reviews.text: BEAUTIFUL camera! The manual controls feel very inuitive and it captures images incredibly! Well worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: Grace

customer_reviews.title: LOVE this camera
customer_reviews.text: I went from a d7000 to this. LOVE this camera! I was ready for a full frame. Does great in low light! So far I’ve been using my 50mm attached and I am not disappointed. Wish I would have upgraded earlier!
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Great camera - "as advertised" ... !
customer_reviews.text: Great camera. I still have yet to explore it thoroughly, nor has it become 'second nature' to me yet, but in the few weeks that I have had it, I am continually impressed. It was the 2014 Camera of the Year for a reason. If you're on the fence, jump. See the many reviews out there for comparisons and strengths ... all I can add is I am finding it exactly as "advertised" ... !
customer_reviews.author: pcg

customer_reviews.title: This is a great camera in low light
customer_reviews.text: This camera replaced my D300s. This is a great camera in low light. I wish it was more in the way of my D300s as far as less searching through menus. I like having everything on the camera and not in a menu and that is why it does not get 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: M. Farmer

customer_reviews.title: Love love love
customer_reviews.text: This is my second D750 - I love everything about this camera. I wanted two for photographing weddings.
customer_reviews.author: EmilyG

customer_reviews.title: It's a nikon and it's great
customer_reviews.text: The autofocus is still not completly reliable but the capability of the camera is AWESOME
customer_reviews.author: D. Pencil

customer_reviews.title: Great camera. If you want full-frame and you don't ...
customer_reviews.text: Great camera. If you want full-frame and you don't want to spend the money on a pro-body, this is you want right here. Feels great in the hand, looks great, takes amazing photos. Auto-focus is quick and sharp, menus are easy to use. The built in wifi takes a bit to recognize that you phone is connected to it, but once it gets going it works well and is easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: S. Christensen

customer_reviews.title: A definite must have!
customer_reviews.text: Having used the D300 for years in both personal and professional capacities, I was always aggravated by the lack of low light performance. Being limited to an ISO of 800 without noticeable noise just wasn't cutting it. Upgrading to the D750 not only gave me the benefit of a full frame sensor, but an amazing improvement in low light performance, image quality, and autofocus performance as well. I have only had the D750 for a month, but I am in love with it. The combination of this body, my nifty fifty, and my 85 1.8 are inseparable
customer_reviews.author: Travis Edwards

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: Took my photos to a whole new level (used to have a crop camera) this is full frame and much better quality!
customer_reviews.author: Ashlie

customer_reviews.title: Excellent performance. So far
customer_reviews.text: Excellent performance. So far, I have used a 24-70mm f2.8, 70-300mm, 16-35mm, 105mm macro and 50mm 1.8 with expected high results. Only thing I would have liked is more flexibility with the screen to actually flip 180 like the cheaper DX cameras.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Miller

customer_reviews.title: Nikon D-750:  Not battle-hardened but otherwise great camera
customer_reviews.text: Functionally, the D-750 I received yesterday is a sweet image-maker. My only negative immediate observation is that it does not appear to be as ruggedly-built as my now-retired D-300. A little on the "plasticky" side with the OK button. Great low-light performance. Will shoot my first gig with it tonight & will report to you guys later.
customer_reviews.author: Marshall Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Great camera!
customer_reviews.text: I sold my Nikon D4 and the D750 became my main camera. The D4 became to heavy for me, after having carpel tunnel surgery on both wrists. I've only used it a few times on pro shoots so far, but it has not disappointed me at all. Love how fast and accurately it focuses. Very comfortable in my hand, and easy to use. It's another Nikon winner.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Barbery

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I have two other Nikon cameras and wanted to go to using just one. I do have to say; this is the one! The pictures are amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Regina

customer_reviews.title: Awesome camera!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this camera! I love the screen, where i can flip it out and take an overhead shot and see what im doing. Not super heavy and the color rendering is great!!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Joyner

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with this camera body
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this camera body. Good low light response. I purchased it from Amazon Warehouse and it was like new with US Warranty for about $500 less than a new one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely brilliant camera. Pictures look gorgeous
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely brilliant camera. Pictures look gorgeous. Autofocus is fast and accurate with the 50mm 1.8g. I wish it had 4k video and 1/8000 shutter, but at this price point, I really can't ask for more. Tip: remap Record to control ISO, then you can access everything with one hand.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Wang

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Device
customer_reviews.text: This camera is exactly as described. I was a bit nervous to buy used since this was my first time but if my transactions remain this smooth, I don't see why I can't continue!
customer_reviews.author: photograpHER

customer_reviews.title: Best 1st full frame camera on a budget
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as my first full frame to replace my D7200!! Pictures are sharp and very clear!!! Best camera IMO to buy as a first full frame!! 24mp won’t eat up your memory card and it has the option to zoom in at 1.5x
customer_reviews.author: Gaudy

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: there was a cracked shutter or sensor in my camera do not know how....I have had this camera past the warranty coverage sent it to Nikon (6 days) just got it back Nikon fixed it for FREE !!!!!!!! I LOVE THIS CAMERA
customer_reviews.author: mel

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous
customer_reviews.text: Love this! Upgraded from my D3400. Taking better pictures and better focus. Fabulous.
customer_reviews.author: KB

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Choice to start Full Format Use
customer_reviews.text: First full format camera and it has been much easier to use seeing that it operates almost identical to my D7100. It makes the learning curve a lot faster. Seems to hit the exposure readings much better then my D7100 does. Shutter is smooth and solidly made. Very happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Wouldchuck

customer_reviews.title: August 2017 Purchase...
customer_reviews.text: After months of reading, you-tubing and internet-review perusal, I dove-in and got this machine. I'm confident, as a result of waiting for the "bugs and fixes" hubbub to subside, that I will not experience those issues delineated by reviewers long past. So far, I am very pleased with my D-750!
customer_reviews.author: Car H.

customer_reviews.title: Standing behind the other good reviewers
customer_reviews.text: I'm not the best at writing reviews, and there are already enough here to explain why this camera is the best of it's kind. I'm here to say that I totally back every person who says this camera is amazing. Also, thanks to all who take the time to write elaborate reviews for the rest of us. We appreciate it!
customer_reviews.author: Mandaburr

customer_reviews.title: Best deal going for a DSLR
customer_reviews.text: Just an all around excellent camera. I paired mine with the G2 Tamron lenses. Very nice pictures.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best Nikon I've ever used.
customer_reviews.text: I work as a full time small newspaper photographer. I've used Nikon equipment all my career. This is the best by far I've ever owned. I've used D3s bodies and this one is as good even on high ISO. I shoot 8000-12,800 often and it looks better than 4000 on my old D7000 body. Get it if you can.
customer_reviews.author: pixmakerdave

customer_reviews.title: Awesome camera
customer_reviews.text: So far love the camera. I need to read more of the instructions because its electronics tend to over ride my intentions. The flash sync and colors are awesome. I have been a Nikon person since the good old days of the Nikon F and this is by far the most advanced and incredible machine.
customer_reviews.author: C. Nixon

customer_reviews.title: I love my new camera
customer_reviews.text: I love my new camera! My husband had some really nice lens from the "film days", so we bought this camera to be able to start using them again. This camera is everything I was hoping for. I have been using to shoot sports shots and really like the 6fps for this. It has been fairly easy to learn where all of the controls are located and to make the necessary changes.
customer_reviews.author: Toni Hagen

It's fast and responsive; shoot 6.5 fps at full resolution. And it's endlessly versatile; shoot stills in multiple formats, video with enhanced definition, smooth time-lapse sequences up to 9,999 shots in-camera and more—all with stunning sharpness and rich tonality. Open new compositional possibilities with its 3.2-inch 1,229k dot tilting Vari-angle LCD display, or use a compatible smartphone or tablet as a remote monitor for Live View shooting. From the Manufacturer Bring your vision to life with Nikon's first full-frame D-SLR to feature a tilting Vari-angle display and built-in Wi-Fi connectivity. With pro-caliber video features inspired by the D810, the same autofocus and metering system used in the D4S and D810, a newly designed 24.3MP FX-format CMOS image sensor and expeed 4 image processor, the D750 delivers a feature set unlike D-SLRs its size. A monocoque design keeps the camera remarkably slim, compact and lightweight, and a control layout based on Nikon's flagship cameras makes for comfortable, intuitive handling. The D750 will deliver superb performance. Full-frame freedom, outstanding agility and the convenience of built-in Wi-Fi. For those who find inspiration everywhere, who switch between stills and video without missing a beat, who want the look only a full-frame D-SLR can achieve and who love sharing their shots, the D750 is the tool to unleash your artistry. With features inspired by D4S and D810, the D750 brings dazzling image quality, cinematic video capabilities and pro-inspired handling in a nimble design with a tilting Vari-angle LCD and built-in Wi-Fi connectivity. Enthusiasts upgrading from a DX-format D-SLR will marvel at the D750's full-frame performance. Pros seeking a primary or secondary camera for fast-paced shoots will appreciate the D750's familiar handling and speed. And filmmakers looking for a compact D-SLR to bring a production to life or to capture B-Roll will find the D750 a perfect fit. The D750 is a thrilling centerpiece of an exceptional imaging system. Its newly designed 24.3MP FX-format CMOS image sensor is paired with EXPEED 4 image processing for fast frame rates, a low noise, wide ISO range of 100 to 12,800 (expandable up to ISO 51,200), Full HD video with enhanced definition and reduced noise at high ISO sensitivities, minimal moiré, jaggies and false colors and a Nikon first—autofocus performance down to -3EV. Paired with the versatile array of full-frame or DX-format NIKKOR lenses, the D750 is capable of telling any story you can imagine. Shoot cinematically Cutting edge HD video capabilities With professional video capabilities inspired by the D810 and an array of inputs and outputs, the D750 is as well-suited for recording daily life and events as it is for filmmaking and videography. Simultaneously record uncompressed and compressed Full HD 1080 footage at 60/50/30/25/24p. Manually control ISO, shutter speed and aperture while recording—even use Power Aperture control for smooth iris transitions and Auto ISO for smooth exposure transitions. Use Highlight Display with zebra stripes to confirm exposure, apply Flat Picture Control for easier color grading in post and record at low and high angles with the 3.2-inch tilting Vari-angle LCD. Stay connected Built-in Wi-Fi sharing and remote control Sharing and transferring your favorite D750 photos is fast, easy and fun. Wirelessly connect to the D750 with a compatible smartphone or tablet, browse the camera's memory card, download your favorite shots and then email them, text them or upload them to your favorite website. You can also use your smart device as a remote monitor and control for the D750—see what the camera sees and fire the shutter. For faster wireless transfers, transmit images over FTP using the WT-5A Wireless Transmitter + UT-1 Communication Unit. (Advanced shooters can use a web browser on a smartphone or tablet in HTTP mode to operate camera controls and begin Live View shooting.) Enjoy the view A first for a Nikon full-frame D-SLR, the D750 features a 3.2-inch 1,229 dot tilting Vari-angle LCD display. It has RGBW alignment and color balance customization, so it can be matched to an external monitor. Use it to shoot from high and low angles, to spot-select white balance during Live View shooting, to access the intuitively redesigned Info. Display or to change settings quickly from the separate Photo Shooting and Movie Shooting menus. Match your view and your vision with the 100% coverage optical viewfinder, which has a bright, clear organic EL display system for making adjustments without taking your eye off the action.
